name: Elementary Chinese I
descripton: Introduction to Modern Standard Chinese. Emphasis on speaking and listening with an introduction to reading, writing and Chinese culture.

name: Elementary Chinese II
descripton: Continuation of basic skills. Emphasis on speaking and listening with some reading, writing and Chinese culture.

name: Elementary Chinese I Conversation
descripton: Supplements conversational practice and handwriting skills for FLC 101.  Students will gain practice at using their speaking skills in a variety of basic social situations.

name: Elementary Chinese II Conversation
prerequisites: Prerequisite: FLC 101 and FLC 103; Corequisite: FLC 102
descripton: Supplements conversational practice and handwriting skills for FLC 102.  Students are encouraged to use their speaking skills in a variety of typical social situations.  Special attention is given to naturalness of speech.

name: Intermediate Chinese I
descripton: Continuation of basic skills. Greater emphasis on reading, writing and Chinese cultural traditions.

name: Intermediate Chinese II
descripton: Continuation of basic skills. Focus on reading, writing, Chinese cultural traditions and patterns of behavior.

name: Intermediate Chinese I Conversation
prerequisites: Prerequisite: FLC 102 and FLC 104; Corequisite: FLC 201
descripton: Supplements conversational practice and handwriting skills for FLC 201.  Students are encouraged to use their speaking skills in a variety of situations.  Special attention is given to naturalness of speech and intonation.

name: Intermediate Chinese II Conversation
prerequisites: Prerequisite: FLC 201 and FLC 203; Corequisite: FLC 202
descripton: Supplements conversational practice and handwriting skills for FLC 202.  Students are encouraged to use their speaking skills in a variety of situations.  Special attention is given to naturalness of speech and intonation.

name: Intermediate Chinese III
descripton: Last of the foundation courses in Chinese. Continued practice in speaking and understanding Chinese with new emphasis on writing and on the reading of cultural and literary texts.

name: Intermediate Chinese IV
descripton: Continued practice in speaking and understanding Chinese with greater emphasis on reading and writing. Continued study of cultural and literary texts.

name: Advanced Chinese: Readings in Literature and Social Sciences
